channel.title: Client #487
channel.description:
Would you mind doing me a favor and posting your outputs here :D!
Thanks, Speedster239...

item.title: Client #487
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:
@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:23, topic:181465”][quote author=super_ link=topic=242967.msg2063890#msg2063890 date=1203394810]
by the way, speedster, good luck with jmacro, but i must say that you’ll have to rewrite/revamp most of ollie’s code, seeing as most of it has broken.
[/quote]fuck off kid, actually do something before trying to play with the big boys[/quote]
frank, i see you’re apart of the ‘greater’ group [br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 19, 2008, 09:55:27 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Iamadam, post:24, topic:181465”]Frank_, don’t forget we have a playdate tomorrow![/quote]
that was actually amusing, thanks for making my day iamadam :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 19, 2008, 09:56:53 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Ollie, post:25, topic:181465”][quote author=super_ link=topic=242967.msg2063890#msg2063890 date=1203394810]
by the way, speedster, good luck with jmacro, but i must say that you’ll have to rewrite/revamp most of ollie’s code, seeing as most of it has broken.
[/quote]
*public code, its due to fuckwits like you i dont like releasing anything of great importance.[br[/quote]
im not insulting your code, you twat, im simply saying that the client has somewhat transformed and changed, and some of your hooks are broken.

item.title: Client #487
item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

super_:

by the way, speedster, good luck with jmacro, but i must say that you’ll have to rewrite/revamp most of ollie’s code, seeing as most of it has broken.

Maybee your mistaken in the fact that I’m just using the base (aka Updater.java and a few other components such as the instruction scanner). As far as JMacro that’s already done and running, it just needs an updater as does any good bot. I’m going to have to go with frank_ on this one.

item.title: Client #487
item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

Be nice to Ollie, all he’s trying to do is offer me some help and you guys are ripping him apart, thank you Ollie, I’ll keep it in mind.

Anyways, I’ve hooked a few more fields and I’ve changed the layout of the updater. I didn’t know which naming schema I should use so I’ve mixed in a bit from what’ I’ve seen around.

Starting JMacro Updater v1 by Speedster239...
Loaded 214 classes in 3031 ms.
Detected Runescape Build #487

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Client]
	--> client implements interface com.updater.hooks.Client
	getFrame() added to class client gets STATIC java.awt.Frame lb.e
	getCanvas() added to class client gets STATIC java.awt.Canvas mb.b
	Replaced SuperclassName "java.awt.Canvas" in pc to "com.updater.hooks.Canvas"

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Player]
	--> kd implements interface com.updater.hooks.Player

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Position]
	 *getLocationX() added to class gi gets FIELD int[] gi.Y
	 *getBaseX() added to class client gets STATIC int sb.j
	 *getMyPlayer() added to class client gets STATIC kd ha.p
	 *getLocationY() added to class gi gets FIELD int[] gi.ab
	 *getBaseY() added to class client gets STATIC int gg.R

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Character]
	--> gi implements interface com.updater.hooks.Character
	 *getAnimation() added to class gi gets FIELD int gi.fb
	 *getMotion() added to class gi gets FIELD int gi.Rb
	 *getX() added to class gi gets FIELD int gi.hc
	 *getY() added to class gi gets FIELD int gi.tc

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Camera]
	 *getCameraZ() added to class client gets STATIC int f.L
	 *getGroundByteArray() added to class client gets STATIC byte[][][] di.tb
	 *getPlane() added to class client gets STATIC int se.v
	 *getCameraX() added to class client gets STATIC int ce.tb
	 *getCameraY() added to class client gets STATIC int ag.h

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Minimap]
	 *getMinimapInt3() added to class client gets STATIC int gg.ab
	 *getCurveArrayY() added to class client gets STATIC int[] b.db
	 *getCurveArrayX() added to class client gets STATIC int[] b.S
	 *getMinimapInt2() added to class client gets STATIC int aa.ob
	 *getMinimapInt1() added to class client gets STATIC int ja.Bb


Completed 21 hooks, 3 interfaces and defined 3 class names in 413 ms, thats approximately 19 ms per hook...
====== JMacro Components ======
MinimapInt1: ja.Bb
MinimapInt2: aa.ob
MinimapInt3: gg.ab
GetX: ha.p.hc
GetY: ha.p.tc
BaseX: sb.j
BaseY: gg.R
getMotion: gi.Rb

item.title: Client #487
item.dc:creator: @speedster239 speedster239
item.description:
@speedster239 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:14, topic:181465”][quote author=speedster239 link=topic=242967.msg2061869#msg2061869 date=1203335093]
Started working on this tonight, it’s using the Ares updater as a base but I still needed to do alot of work to get everything up to speed for this version, infact all of the hooks below were broken to some extent.

Starting JMacro Updater v1 by Speedster239...
Loaded 214 classes in 465 ms.
Detected Runescape Build #487

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Player]
	--> kd implemets interface com.updater.hooks.Player

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Position]
	 *getLocationX() -> class gi : FIELD int[] gi.Y
	 *getBaseX() -> class client : STATIC int sb.j
	 *getMyPlayer() -> class client : STATIC kd ha.p
	 *getLocationY() -> class gi : FIELD int[] gi.ab
	 *getBaseY() -> class client : STATIC int gg.R

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Character]
	--> gi implemets interface com.updater.hooks.Character
	 *getAnimation() -> class gi : FIELD int gi.fb
	 *getMotion() -> class gi : FIELD int gi.Rb
	 *getX() -> class gi : FIELD int gi.hc
	 *getY() -> class gi : FIELD int gi.tc

[Running class com.updater.patterns.Minimap]
	 *getMinimapInt3() -> class client : STATIC int gg.ab
	 *getCurveArrayY() -> class client : STATIC int[] b.db
	 *getCurveArrayX() -> class client : STATIC int[] b.S
	 *getMinimapInt2() -> class client : STATIC int aa.ob
	 *getMinimapInt1() -> class client : STATIC int ja.Bb


Completed 14 hooks, 2 interfaces and defined 2 class names in 166 ms, thats approximately 11 ms per hook...

Since it’s a new updater and all (and my first :D), I’m going to be testing it back on older releases…
[/quote]
sort out your naming schema, also it made me laugh when you said you were using ares updater =]
thats about 30+ revisions old now[/quote]

It wasn’t in good shape either, but the base is pretty well written and since I’m new too updating It’s a good place to start. As far as organizing it all I’m going to work on that now.

Read full topic
